csharp_simple:
1using System;
2using System.Collections.Generic;
3​
4namespace TechnicalIndicators
5{
6 /// <summary>
7 /// Triple Exponential Moving Average (TEMA)
8 /// </summary>
9 /// <remarks>
10 /// Reduces lag even more than DEMA.
11 /// <list type="bullet">
12 /// <item><description>Formula: 3*EMA1 - 3*EMA2 + EMA3.</description></item>
13 /// <item><description>Very responsive to price changes.</description></item>
14 /// </list>
15 /// </remarks>
16 public class TripleExponentialMovingAverage
17 {
18 public int Period { get; }
19 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
20​
21 public TripleExponentialMovingAverage(int period)
22 {
23 if (period <= 0) throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException(nameof(period));
24 Period = period;
25 }
26​
27 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
28 {
29 Values.Clear();
30 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
31 if (candleList.Count == 0) return;
32​
33 var ema1 = CalculateEma(candleList, Period);
34 var ema2 = CalculateEmaFromValues(ema1, Period);
35 var ema3 = CalculateEmaFromValues(ema2, Period);
36​
37 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
38 {
39 if (i < ema1.Count && i < ema2.Count && i < ema3.Count &&
40 ema1[i].HasValue && ema2[i].HasValue && ema3[i].HasValue)
41 {
42 Values.Add(3 * ema1[i]!.Value - 3 * ema2[i]!.Value + ema3[i]!.Value);
43 }
44 else
45 {
46 Values.Add(null);
47 }
48 }
49 }
50​
51 private static List<decimal?> CalculateEma(List<CandleData> candles, int period)
52 {
53 // Standard EMA from Candles
54 var results = new List<decimal?>();
55 decimal k = 2.0m / (period + 1);
56 decimal? prevEma = null;
57​
58 for (int i = 0; i < candles.Count; i++)
59 {
60 if (i < period - 1) { results.Add(null); continue; }
61 if (i == period - 1)
62 {
63 decimal sum = 0;
64 for (int j = 0; j < period; j++) sum += candles[i - j].Close;
65 prevEma = sum / period;
66 results.Add(prevEma);
67 continue;
68 }
69 decimal ema = (candles[i].Close - prevEma.Value) * k + prevEma.Value;
70 results.Add(ema);
71 prevEma = ema;
72 }
73 return results;
74 }
75​
76 private static List<decimal?> CalculateEmaFromValues(List<decimal?> source, int period)
77 {
78 // EMA from nullable values list
79 var results = new List<decimal?>();
80 decimal k = 2.0m / (period + 1);
81 decimal? prevEma = null;
82 int validCount = 0;
83​
84 for (int i = 0; i < source.Count; i++)
85 {
86 if (!source[i].HasValue) { results.Add(null); continue; }
87 validCount++;
88​
89 if (validCount < period) { results.Add(null); continue; }
90 if (validCount == period)
91 {
92 decimal sum = 0;
93 int count = 0;
94 for (int j = i; j >= 0 && count < period; j--)
95 {
96 if (source[j].HasValue) { sum += source[j]!.Value; count++; }
97 }
98 prevEma = sum / count;
99 results.Add(prevEma);
100 continue;
101 }
102 decimal ema = (source[i]!.Value - prevEma.Value) * k + prevEma.Value;
103 results.Add(ema);
104 prevEma = ema;
105 }
106 return results;
107 }
108​
109 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int period)
110 {
111 var tema = new TripleExponentialMovingAverage(period);
112 tema.Calculate(candles);
113 return tema.Values;
114 }
115 }
116}
csharp_detailed:
1// =============================================================================
2// TRIPLE EXPONENTIAL MOVING AVERAGE (TEMA) - Extreme Tutorial Mode
3// =============================================================================
4//
5// [What] Triple Exponential Moving Average (TEMA), developed by Patrick Mulloy,
6// combines three EMAs to significantly reduce lag while maintaining
7// smoothness. It's designed to follow price more closely than EMA.
8//
9// [Why] EMA reduces SMA lag, but still has significant delay. TEMA uses a
10// clever formula to cancel much of EMA's lag:
11// - Triple smoothing for noise reduction
12// - Lag cancellation through formula design
13// - More responsive to price changes
14//
15// [Visual] Lag Comparison (Same Period):
16//
17// Price: ╱╲ ╱╲
18// ╱ ╲╱ ╲
19//
20// SMA: ╱╲ ╱╲ (Most lag)
21// ╱ ╲╱ ╲
22//
23// EMA: ╱╲ ╱╲ (Medium lag)
24// ╱ ╲╱ ╲
25//
26// TEMA: ╱╲ ╱╲ (Least lag - closest to price)
27// ╱ ╲╱ ╲
28//
29// [How] The TEMA Formula:
30//
31// ┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
32// │ TEMA = 3 × EMA1 - 3 × EMA2 + EMA3 │
33// │ │
34// │ Where: │
35// │ EMA1 = EMA(Close, Period) ← First smoothing │
36// │ EMA2 = EMA(EMA1, Period) ← Second smoothing │
37// │ EMA3 = EMA(EMA2, Period) ← Third smoothing │
38// └─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
39//
40// [Why This Formula Works]
41// Each EMA level introduces lag. The formula weights:
42// - 3 × EMA1: Heavy weight on least-lagged component
43// - -3 × EMA2: Subtract some of the lag
44// - +EMA3: Add back a tiny bit for stability
45// Result: Lag largely cancels out!
46//
47// =============================================================================
48​
49using System;
50using System.Collections.Generic;
51​
52namespace TechnicalIndicators
53{
54 // =========================================================================
55 // [What] CandleData: Immutable record for OHLCV price bar data
56 // =========================================================================
57 public readonly record struct CandleData(
58 DateTime Timestamp,
59 decimal Open,
60 decimal High,
61 decimal Low,
62 decimal Close,
63 long Volume
64 );
65​
66 // =========================================================================
67 // [What] TripleExponentialMovingAverage Class: Lag-reduced EMA
68 // =========================================================================
69 public class TripleExponentialMovingAverage
70 {
71 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
72 // [What] Period: EMA period (applied to all three levels)
73 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
74 public int Period { get; }
75​
76 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
77 // [What] Values: Stores the calculated TEMA for each bar
78 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
79 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
80​
81 // =====================================================================
82 // [What] Constructor: Initialize with period
83 // =====================================================================
84 public TripleExponentialMovingAverage(int period)
85 {
86 if (period <= 0)
87 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException(nameof(period), "Period must be greater than 0");
88 Period = period;
89 }
90​
91 // =====================================================================
92 // [What] Calculate: Main computation method
93 // =====================================================================
94 //
95 // [IPO Block]
96 // ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
97 // │ INPUT: candles - Collection of OHLCV price bars │
98 // │ PROCESS: Calculate three nested EMAs, combine with formula │
99 // │ OUTPUT: Values list with TEMA for each bar │
100 // └──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
101 //
102 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
103 {
104 Values.Clear();
105 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
106​
107 if (candleList.Count == 0) return;
108​
109 // =================================================================
110 // STEP 1: Calculate EMA1 (First Level)
111 // =================================================================
112 //
113 // [What] EMA of closing prices
114 //
115 // [Visual] EMA1 Pipeline:
116 // Close → EMA(Period) → EMA1
117 //
118 // -----------------------------------------------------------------
119 var ema1 = CalculateEma(candleList, Period);
120​
121 // =================================================================
122 // STEP 2: Calculate EMA2 (Second Level)
123 // =================================================================
124 //
125 // [What] EMA of EMA1 values
126 //
127 // [Visual] EMA2 Pipeline:
128 // EMA1 → EMA(Period) → EMA2
129 // (Introduces additional smoothing and lag)
130 //
131 // -----------------------------------------------------------------
132 var ema2 = CalculateEmaFromValues(ema1, Period);
133​
134 // =================================================================
135 // STEP 3: Calculate EMA3 (Third Level)
136 // =================================================================
137 //
138 // [What] EMA of EMA2 values
139 //
140 // [Visual] EMA3 Pipeline:
141 // EMA2 → EMA(Period) → EMA3
142 // (Smoothest, but most lagged)
143 //
144 // -----------------------------------------------------------------
145 var ema3 = CalculateEmaFromValues(ema2, Period);
146​
147 // =================================================================
148 // STEP 4: Combine Using TEMA Formula
149 // =================================================================
150 //
151 // [Formula] TEMA = 3 × EMA1 - 3 × EMA2 + EMA3
152 //
153 // [Visual] Weight Interpretation:
154 // Component│ Lag │ Weight │ Effect
155 // ─────────┼──────┼────────┼───────────────────
156 // EMA1 │ Low │ +3 │ Follow price closely
157 // EMA2 │ Med │ -3 │ Subtract lagged signal
158 // EMA3 │ High │ +1 │ Add stability
159 //
160 // [Result] Lag largely cancels; responsiveness remains
161 //
162 // -----------------------------------------------------------------
163 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
164 {
165 if (i < ema1.Count && i < ema2.Count && i < ema3.Count &&
166 ema1[i].HasValue && ema2[i].HasValue && ema3[i].HasValue)
167 {
168 Values.Add(3 * ema1[i]!.Value - 3 * ema2[i]!.Value + ema3[i]!.Value);
169 }
170 else
171 {
172 Values.Add(null);
173 }
174 }
175 }
176​
177 // =====================================================================
178 // [What] CalculateEma: EMA from candle close prices
179 // =====================================================================
180 //
181 // [IPO Block]
182 // ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
183 // │ INPUT: candles - Price bars, period - EMA period │
184 // │ PROCESS: Standard EMA with SMA seed for first value │
185 // │ OUTPUT: List of EMA values │
186 // └──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
187 //
188 private static List<decimal?> CalculateEma(List<CandleData> candles, int period)
189 {
190 var results = new List<decimal?>();
191 if (candles.Count == 0 || period <= 0) return results;
192​
193 // EMA smoothing factor: k = 2 / (period + 1)
194 decimal k = 2.0m / (period + 1);
195 decimal? prevEma = null;
196​
197 for (int i = 0; i < candles.Count; i++)
198 {
199 // Warm-up period: output null
200 if (i < period - 1)
201 {
202 results.Add(null);
203 continue;
204 }
205​
206 // First EMA value: use SMA as seed
207 if (i == period - 1)
208 {
209 decimal sum = 0;
210 for (int j = 0; j < period; j++)
211 sum += candles[i - j].Close;
212 prevEma = sum / period;
213 results.Add(prevEma);
214 continue;
215 }
216​
217 // Standard EMA: EMA = (Close - PrevEMA) × k + PrevEMA
218 if (prevEma != null)
219 {
220 decimal ema = (candles[i].Close - prevEma.Value) * k + prevEma.Value;
221 results.Add(ema);
222 prevEma = ema;
223 }
224 else
225 {
226 results.Add(null);
227 }
228 }
229 return results;
230 }
231​
232 // =====================================================================
233 // [What] CalculateEmaFromValues: EMA with nullable input handling
234 // =====================================================================
235 //
236 // [IPO Block]
237 // ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
238 // │ INPUT: source - List with nulls, period - EMA period │
239 // │ PROCESS: Apply EMA, skipping nulls intelligently │
240 // │ OUTPUT: List of EMA values (may have nulls) │
241 // └──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
242 //
243 private static List<decimal?> CalculateEmaFromValues(List<decimal?> source, int period)
244 {
245 var results = new List<decimal?>();
246 if (source.Count == 0 || period <= 0) return results;
247​
248 decimal k = 2.0m / (period + 1);
249 decimal? prevEma = null;
250 int validCount = 0;
251​
252 for (int i = 0; i < source.Count; i++)
253 {
254 // Skip null source values
255 if (!source[i].HasValue)
256 {
257 results.Add(null);
258 continue;
259 }
260​
261 validCount++;
262​
263 // Accumulate until we have enough valid values
264 if (validCount < period)
265 {
266 results.Add(null);
267 continue;
268 }
269​
270 // First valid EMA: use SMA of first 'period' valid values
271 if (validCount == period)
272 {
273 decimal sum = 0;
274 int count = 0;
275 for (int j = i; j >= 0 && count < period; j--)
276 {
277 if (source[j].HasValue)
278 {
279 sum += source[j]!.Value;
280 count++;
281 }
282 }
283 prevEma = count > 0 ? sum / count : null;
284 results.Add(prevEma);
285 continue;
286 }
287​
288 // Standard EMA calculation
289 if (prevEma.HasValue)
290 {
291 decimal ema = (source[i]!.Value - prevEma.Value) * k + prevEma.Value;
292 results.Add(ema);
293 prevEma = ema;
294 }
295 else
296 {
297 results.Add(null);
298 }
299 }
300 return results;
301 }
302​
303 // =====================================================================
304 // [What] Calculate: Static convenience method
305 // =====================================================================
306 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int period)
307 {
308 var tema = new TripleExponentialMovingAverage(period);
309 tema.Calculate(candles);
310 return tema.Values;
311 }
312 }
313}
python_simple:
1class TripleExponentialMovingAverage:
2 """
3 TEMA
4 """
5 def __init__(self, period=14):
6 self.period = period
7 self.values = []
8​
9 def calculate(self, candles):
10 self.values.clear()
11 if not candles: return
12​
13 # EMA 1
14 ema1 = self._calc_ema(candles, self.period)
15 # EMA 2 (of EMA 1)
16 ema2 = self._calc_ema_values(ema1, self.period)
17 # EMA 3 (of EMA 2)
18 ema3 = self._calc_ema_values(ema2, self.period)
19​
20 for i in range(len(candles)):
21 if i < len(ema1) and i < len(ema2) and i < len(ema3):
22 e1 = ema1[i]
23 e2 = ema2[i]
24 e3 = ema3[i]
25
26 if e1 is not None and e2 is not None and e3 is not None:
27 # 3*E1 - 3*E2 + E3
28 val = 3*e1 - 3*e2 + e3
29 self.values.append(val)
30 else:
31 self.values.append(None)
32 else:
33 self.values.append(None)
34​
35 def _calc_ema(self, candles, period):
36 res = []
37 k = 2.0 / (period + 1)
38 prev = None
39 for i in range(len(candles)):
40 c = float(candles[i]['close'])
41 if i < period - 1:
42 res.append(None)
43 elif i == period - 1:
44 subset = [float(candles[x]['close']) for x in range(i-period+1, i+1)]
45 prev = sum(subset) / period
46 res.append(prev)
47 else:
48 val = (c - prev) * k + prev
49 res.append(val)
50 prev = val
51 return res
52​
53 def _calc_ema_values(self, source, period):
54 res = []
55 k = 2.0 / (period + 1)
56 prev = None
57 valid_cnt = 0
58 for i in range(len(source)):
59 if source[i] is None:
60 res.append(None)
61 continue
62
63 valid_cnt += 1
64 if valid_cnt < period:
65 res.append(None)
66 elif valid_cnt == period:
67 subset = [x for x in source[i-period+1 : i+1] if x is not None]
68 if len(subset) == period:
69 prev = sum(subset) / period
70 res.append(prev)
71 else:
72 res.append(None)
73 else:
74 val = (source[i] - prev) * k + prev
75 res.append(val)
76 prev = val
77 return res
78​
79def calculate(candles, period=14):
80 obj = TripleExponentialMovingAverage(period)
81 obj.calculate(candles)
82 return obj.values
python_detailed:
1# =============================================================================
2# Logic Breakdown (Triple Exponential Moving Average)
3# =============================================================================
4#
5# This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6# Triple Exponential Moving Average (TEMA).
7#
8# [Core Concepts]
9# 1. Lag Reduction (The "Zero Lag" Goal)
10# - Standard EMA lags behind price.
11# - EMA of EMA (Double EMA) lags even more.
12# - EMA of EMA of EMA (Triple EMA) lags the most.
13# - Paradoxically, TEMA combines these three lagging components to cancel out the lag.
14#
15# 2. The Formula Logic (Taylor Series Expansion)
16# - TEMA = 3*EMA1 - 3*EMA2 + EMA3.
17# - It essentially overweights the single EMA and subtracts the doubly-smoothed
18# parts to correct the error (lag).
19#
20# [Formula]
21# EMA1 = EMA(Price)
22# EMA2 = EMA(EMA1)
23# EMA3 = EMA(EMA2)
24# TEMA = 3*EMA1 - 3*EMA2 + EMA3
25#
26# =============================================================================
27​
28# -------------------------------------------------------------
29# Type-Level Explanation: TripleExponentialMovingAverage (class)
30#
31# [Why] Fast response trend following with smooth output.
32# [What] Lag-corrected Composite EMA.
33# [How] Uses a combination of single, double, and triple EMAs to cancel out the lag (3*EMA1 - 3*EMA2 + EMA3).
34# [Who] Patrick Mulloy (1994).
35# -------------------------------------------------------------
36class TripleExponentialMovingAverage:
37
38 # -------------------------------------------------------------
39 # Constructor: __init__
40 # -------------------------------------------------------------
41 def __init__(self, period):
42 if period <= 0:
43 raise ValueError("period must be > 0")
44 self.period = period
45 self.values = []
46​
47 # =============================================================================
48 # IPO: calculate
49 # =============================================================================
50 #
51 # [Input]
52 # - candles: List[dict]
53 #
54 # [Process]
55 # 1. Compute EMA1 (of Close).
56 # 2. Compute EMA2 (of EMA1).
57 # 3. Compute EMA3 (of EMA2).
58 # 4. Combine using: 3*E1 - 3*E2 + E3.
59 #
60 # [Output]
61 # - None.
62 # =============================================================================
63 def calculate(self, candles):
64
65 # -------------------------------------------------------------
66 # Logic Step 1: Reset
67 # -------------------------------------------------------------
68 self.values.clear()
69 if len(candles) == 0:
70 return
71​
72 # -------------------------------------------------------------
73 # Logic Step 2: Compute Component EMAs
74 # [Why] We need varying degrees of smoothing (and lag).
75 # [How] Recursive EMA calculation.
76 # -------------------------------------------------------------
77 # First Layer: EMA of Price
78 ema1_series = self._calc_ema_candles(candles, self.period)
79
80 # Second Layer: EMA of EMA1
81 ema2_series = self._calc_ema_list(ema1_series, self.period)
82
83 # Third Layer: EMA of EMA2
84 ema3_series = self._calc_ema_list(ema2_series, self.period)
85​
86 # -------------------------------------------------------------
87 # Logic Step 3: Combination (The TEMA Formula)
88 # [Why] Combining them cancels out the lag term.
89 # [How] 3*EMA1 - 3*EMA2 + EMA3.
90 # -------------------------------------------------------------
91 for i in range(len(candles)):
92 e1 = ema1_series[i]
93 e2 = ema2_series[i]
94 e3 = ema3_series[i]
95
96 # Check for validity of all components
97 if e1 is None or e2 is None or e3 is None:
98 self.values.append(None)
99 else:
100 # [Visual Math]
101 # If Price jumps, E1 jumps part way. E2 lags behind.
102 # 3*E1 pushes it forward. -3*E2 pulls back over-correction.
103 val = (3 * e1) - (3 * e2) + e3
104 self.values.append(val)
105​
106​
107 # =============================================================================
108 # IPO: _calc_ema_candles (Helper)
109 # =============================================================================
110 # [Process] Standard Price EMA. Seeded with SMA.
111 # =============================================================================
112 def _calc_ema_candles(self, candles, period):
113 results = []
114 alpha = 2.0 / (period + 1.0)
115 ema = None
116
117 # SMA Seed Logic
118 # We need sum of first 'period' items
119 running_sum_seed = 0.0
120
121 for i in range(len(candles)):
122 c = candles[i]['close']
123
124 if i < period - 1:
125 running_sum_seed += c
126 results.append(None)
127 continue
128
129 if i == period - 1:
130 running_sum_seed += c
131 ema = running_sum_seed / period
132 results.append(ema)
133 continue
134
135 # Recursive Step
136 ema = (c - ema) * alpha + ema
137 results.append(ema)
138
139 return results
140​
141 # =============================================================================
142 # IPO: _calc_ema_list (Helper)
143 # =============================================================================
144 # [Process] EMA of a list of values (that may contain None gaps).
145 # [Why] Used for EMA2 and EMA3.
146 # =============================================================================
147 def _calc_ema_list(self, source, period):
148 results = []
149 alpha = 2.0 / (period + 1.0)
150 ema = None
151
152 # Valid Value Counter for Seeding
153 valid_buffer = []
154
155 for i in range(len(source)):
156 val = source[i]
157
158 # Handle Gap
159 if val is None:
160 results.append(None)
161 continue
162
163 # Init State (Seeding)
164 if ema is None:
165 valid_buffer.append(val)
166 if len(valid_buffer) < period:
167 results.append(None)
168 else:
169 # SMA Seed
170 ema = sum(valid_buffer) / period
171 results.append(ema)
172 else:
173 # Recursive Step
174 ema = (val - ema) * alpha + ema
175 results.append(ema)
176
177 return results
178​
179​
180# =============================================================================
181# Static Wrapper Function
182# =============================================================================
183def calculate(candles, period):
184 tema = TripleExponentialMovingAverage(period)
185 tema.calculate(candles)
186 return tema.values
